data.Ques: What is TypeScript?

How do you compile a TypeScript file named app.ts?
Which keyword is used to define a variable in TypeScript?
How do you specify the type of a variable in TypeScript?
Which of the following is true about interfaces in TypeScript?
data.option1: Interfaces can be used to define the structure of an object.
data.option2: Interfaces can be used to define function types.
data.option3: Interfaces can be implemented by classes.

data.Ques: What is the purpose of the tsconfig.json file?
data.option1: To define the configuration for the TypeScript compiler.
data.option2: To list all TypeScript files in the project.
data.option3: To set environment variables for TypeScript.

data.Ques: How do you define a function in TypeScript that takes a number and returns a string?
Which TypeScript feature allows you to specify default values for function parameters?

data.option1: Hello, my name is John and I am years old.
data.option2: Hello, my name is John and I am 25 years old.
data.option3: Hello, my name is John and I am undefined years old.
data.option4: Hello, my name is John and I am NaN years old.

data.option1: To represent the type of values that never occur.
data.option2: To represent the absence of a value.
data.option3: To represent the type of a variable that can hold any value.
data.option4: To represent the type of a variable that can be null.
